chess

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Piece
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook

    public class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Kishan Patel, Neal Patel

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.lang.String color
      The color of a piece "w" for white "b" for black
      boolean firstMove
      Check to see if a piece is moving for the first time or not - only needs to be handled for some pieces true = still hasn't moved false = has moved at least one time
      java.lang.String piece
      The type of piece "p" for pawn "R" for rook "N" for knight "B" for bishop "Q" for queen "K" for king
      int x
      X location of a piece on the board
      int y
      Y location of a piece on the board

        The type of piece "p" for pawn "R" for rook "N" for knight "B" for bishop "Q" for queen "K" for king

        Check to see if a piece is moving for the first time or not - only needs to be handled for some pieces true = still hasn't moved false = has moved at least one time

    • Constructor Detail

      • Piece

        public Piece(java.lang.String color,
             int x,
             int y,
             java.lang.String piece,
             boolean firstMove)
        Constructor for all pieces
        Parameters:
        color - "w" is for white team, "b" is for black team
        x - X location on the board
        y - Y location on the board
        piece - to represent a piece on the board
        firstMove - check to see if piece made first move or not - only need to be handled for some pieces

      • getPiece

        public java.lang.String getPiece()
        Returns the type of a piece on the board
        Returns:
        "p" for pawn, "R" for rook, "N" for knight, "B" for bishop, "Q" for queen, "K" for king

      • setPiece

        public void setPiece(java.lang.String piece)
        Sets the type of a piece on the board
        Parameters:
        piece - "p" for pawn, "R" for rook, "N" for knight, "B" for bishop, "Q" for queen, "K" for king

      • isFirstMove

        public boolean isFirstMove()
        Return true or false depending on if piece moved already or not
        Returns:
        true means hasn't moved yet, false means moved at least one time

      • setFirstMove

        public void setFirstMove(boolean firstMove)
        Sets the piece to true or false depending on if the piece moved yet or not
        Parameters:
        firstMove - true means hasn't moved yet, false means moved at least one time

      • inCheck

        public boolean inCheck(int currX,
                       int currY,
                       java.lang.String color,
                       Piece[][] board)
        Checks to see if a king is in check or not
        Parameters:
        currX - the current/old X location of a piece on the board
        currY - the current/old Y location of a piece on the board
        color - the team/color of the piece
        board - board of the game where the piece is
        Returns:
        true if king in check, false otherwise

      • movesToCheck

        public boolean movesToCheck(int currX,
                            int currY,
                            java.lang.String color,
                            Piece[][] board,
                            int newX,
                            int newY)
        Checks to see if a move for the king piece in check is allowed or not
        Parameters:
        currX - the current/old X location of a piece on the board
        currY - the current/old Y location of a piece on the board
        color - the team/color of the piece
        board - board of the game where the piece is
        newX - the new X location of a piece on the board
        newY - the new Y location of a piece on the board
        Returns:
        returns true is move not allowed, false otherwise

      • validMove

        public boolean validMove(int currX,
                         int currY,
                         java.lang.String color,
                         Piece[][] board,
                         int newX,
                         int newY)
        Checks if a move is valid. Used within kingMoves method to determine if a king in check has any possible moves
        Parameters:
        currX - current X location of King on the board
        currY - current Y location of King on the board
        color - the team/color of the King
        board - board of the game where the piece is
        newX - new X location that is checked to see if move is valid
        newY - new Y location that is checked to see if move is valid
        Returns:
        true if move is valid, false otherwise

      • kingMoves

        public boolean kingMoves(int currX,
                         int currY,
                         java.lang.String color,
                         Piece[][] board)
        Check if there are any valid moves left for a king that is in check
        Parameters:
        currX - current X location of King on the board
        currY - current Y location of King on the board
        color - the team/color of the King
        board - board of the game where the piece is
        Returns:
        true if there are still valid moves left, false is there are none

      • savesKing

        public boolean savesKing(int currX,
                         int currY,
                         java.lang.String color,
                         Piece[][] board,
                         int newX,
                         int newY,
                         char promote,
                         boolean empassant)
        Checks if non-king piece can bring King out of check
        Parameters:
        currX - current/old X location on the board
        currY - current/old Y location on the board
        color - the team/color of the piece
        board - board of the game where the piece is
        newX - new X location on the board
        newY - new Y location on the board
        promote - used for handling pawn promotion
        empassant - to check if an empassant move is possible for pawn
        Returns:
        true if piece can bring king out of check, false otherwise

      • move

        public java.lang.String move(int currX,
                             int currY,
                             java.lang.String color,
                             Piece[][] board,
                             int newX,
                             int newY,
                             char promote,
                             boolean empassant)
        Check if move is allowed or not for all pieces - goes to piece specified in user input
        Parameters:
        currX - current/old X location on the board
        currY - current/old Y location on the board
        color - the team/color of the piece
        board - board of the game where the piece is
        newX - new X location on the board
        newY - new Y location on the board
        promote - to handle pawn promotion - only need to be handled for some pieces
        empassant - to check if an empassant move is possible - only need to be handled for some pieces
        Returns:
        "w" if the next turn should be whites turn to move, "b" if the next turn should be blacks turn to move
